result.allergensDescription: These allergens may cause reactions in sensitive individuals. Always check product labels before consumption.
result.additivesDescription: Additives are substances added to food to preserve flavor, enhance taste, or improve appearance. Each additive has specific properties and safety considerations.
result.additivesNote: E-numbers are European food additive codes. Not all additives are harmful - many are natural or safe. Consult with healthcare professionals if you have concerns about specific additives.

result.contributeError: Unable to open Open Food Facts. Please try again later or visit world.openfoodfacts.org directly.
result.palmOilFlagsDescription: Understanding palm oil flags helps you make informed choices. Each flag represents a different level of environmental impact and sustainability.
result.greenFlagDescription: This product does not contain palm oil or palm oil derivatives. Products with a green flag have no palm oil content, making them the most environmentally friendly option. By choosing palm oil-free products, you help reduce the demand for palm oil plantations, which are a leading cause of deforestation, biodiversity loss, and climate change. This is the best choice for environmental sustainability.
result.orangeFlagDescription: This product contains palm oil, but its sustainability status is unknown or not verified. Palm oil itself is not inherently bad - when produced sustainably, it can be an efficient crop. However, the majority of palm oil comes from unsustainable sources. The orange flag indicates that the product contains palm oil, and you should look for additional information such as RSPO (Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil) certification to ensure it comes from responsible sources.
result.redFlagDescription: This product contains palm oil that is likely from non-sustainable sources. Products with a red flag have been identified as containing palm oil that may contribute to deforestation, habitat destruction, and environmental degradation. This is the most concerning category, as non-sustainable palm oil production is one of the leading causes of rainforest destruction, particularly in Indonesia and Malaysia. Purchasing these products directly supports practices that threaten endangered species like orangutans, tigers, and elephants, while also contributing significantly to climate change.
result.benefitNoHabitatLoss: No habitat destruction for endangered species
result.lookRSPOCert: RSPO (Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil) certification
result.rspoInfo: RSPO Certified palm oil ensures no deforestation, no peat development, and fair labor practices.
result.impactCarbonRelease: Releases massive amounts of stored carbon dioxide
result.redFlagWarning: Consider choosing palm oil-free alternatives or products with verified sustainable palm oil (RSPO certified) to minimize environmental impact.
result.palmOilInfo: Palm oil is a vegetable oil derived from the fruit of oil palm trees. It is widely used in processed foods, cosmetics, and cleaning products due to its versatility and low cost. However, its production has significant environmental and social impacts when not managed sustainably.
result.palmOilNote: Making informed choices about palm oil can help protect our planet and its wildlife. When possible, choose products with sustainable palm oil or palm oil-free alternatives. Your choices matter in the fight against deforestation and climate change.
result.greenFlagSummary: Benefits and why it's the best choice
result.orangeFlagSummary: Guidance on what to look for (RSPO certification, etc.)

trustScore.title: Understanding Trust Score
trustScore.description: TruScore is a comprehensive rating (0-100) based entirely on recognized public systems. Four equal pillars (25 points each): Body, Planet, Care, and Open. 100% transparent methodology with no proprietary formulas.
trustScore.howItWorksText: TruScore evaluates products across four equal pillars, each contributing 25 points (0-25 each) to the total score (0-100). All scoring is based entirely on recognized public systems with direct conversions - no proprietary formulas.
trustScore.step1: Calculate Body score (0-25) using Nutri-Score, NOVA classification, additives, and allergens
trustScore.step2: Calculate Planet score (0-25) using Eco-Score, packaging recyclability, and palm oil detection
trustScore.step3: Calculate Care score (0-25) using certifications (Fairtrade, Organic, MSC, etc.) with explicit bonuses
trustScore.step4: Calculate Open score (0-25) by detecting hidden ingredient terms (parfum, fragrance, proprietary blend)
trustScore.step5: Sum all four pillars: TruScore = Body + Planet + Care + Open (0-100 total)
trustScore.sustainabilityDesc: Evaluates environmental impact, including carbon footprint, water usage, packaging sustainability, and agricultural practices. Higher scores indicate more sustainable production methods.
trustScore.ethicsDesc: Assesses ethical considerations such as fair trade practices, animal welfare, labor conditions, and supply chain transparency. Products with strong ethical standards receive higher scores.
trustScore.nutritionDesc: Measures nutritional quality based on ingredients, additives, nutrient density, and health impacts. Focuses on whole foods, minimal processing, and beneficial nutrients.
trustScore.bodySafetyDesc: Evaluates safety for your body using Nutri-Score (recognized nutritional quality standard), high-risk additives flagged by EFSA/EWG, and allergen information. Higher scores indicate safer, healthier products for consumption.
trustScore.processingDesc: Analyzes the level of food processing using the NOVA classification system, additive count, and ingredient list length. Lower processing levels (fresh, minimally processed), fewer additives, and shorter ingredient lists receive higher scores than ultra-processed foods.
trustScore.transparencyDesc: Measures the completeness and availability of product information. Evaluates data richness including product name, brand, ingredients list, nutrition facts, origin information, and certifications. Higher scores indicate more transparent and complete product data.
trustScore.excellentDesc: Outstanding quality across all 4 pillars (Body, Planet, Care, Open). These products excel in nutrition, sustainability, ethics, and transparency.
trustScore.goodDesc: Above-average quality with strong performance in most categories. Good choice for conscious consumers.
trustScore.fairDesc: Moderate quality with room for improvement. Acceptable but not exceptional in key areas.
trustScore.poorDesc: Below-average quality. These products may have significant issues in Body safety, Planet sustainability, Care ethics, or Open transparency.
trustScore.note: TruScore v1.3 is calculated based on available product data from Open Food Facts, Open Beauty Facts, and UPCitemdb. The score is only displayed when sufficient verified data is available. 100% of scoring comes from recognized public systems (Nutri-Score, Eco-Score, NOVA, OFF labels) - no proprietary formulas. Each pillar uses direct conversions from official systems (A=25, B=20, etc.). When Nutri-Score or Eco-Score are missing, scores are calculated from available data with appropriate baselines (12 points instead of 25).
trustScore.dataSourceNote: Data Sources: Open Food Facts (world.openfoodfacts.org), Open Beauty Facts (world.openbeautyfacts.org), UPCitemdb (api.upcitemdb.com), Barcode Spider, FDA Food Recall API (fda.gov/food/recalls). All calculations are transparent and verifiable.
trustScore.scoringDescription: TruScore ranges from 0-100, with each of the 4 pillars contributing 0-25 points. Higher scores indicate better overall product quality across all dimensions.
trustScore.dataSourcesDescription: TruScore is 100% based on recognized public systems. Below are the exact data sources and calculation methods for each pillar:
trustScore.transparencyNote: 100% of TruScore calculations are based on recognized public systems. No proprietary formulas are used. All conversions are direct and transparent (e.g., Nutri-Score A=25, B=20, C=15, D=10, E=5). This ensures maximum credibility and zero reputational risk.
trustScore.bodyDesc: Evaluates safety for your body using Nutri-Score (recognized EU nutritional quality standard), NOVA processing classification (São Paulo University system), high-risk additives flagged by EFSA/EWG, and allergen information. NOVA classification is now merged into Body pillar (NOVA 1=+3, NOVA 3=-3, NOVA 4=-8). Higher scores indicate safer, healthier products.
trustScore.planetDesc: Assesses environmental impact using Eco-Score (French Agence de la Transition Écologique system), packaging recyclability, and palm oil deforestation risk. Higher scores indicate products that respect the planet and fight climate change.
trustScore.careDesc: Measures ethical and welfare considerations using certifications from Open Food Facts (1,000+ recognized certifications). Explicit bonus structure: Fairtrade +8, EU Organic +7, MSC/ASC +6, Rainforest Alliance +6, etc. Multiple labels can stack up to +25 points maximum. Higher scores indicate products that show care for people and animals.
trustScore.openDesc: Evaluates ingredient disclosure transparency by detecting hidden terms like 'parfum', 'fragrance', 'natural flavor', and 'proprietary blend'. Higher scores indicate products that are completely open about what's inside - no hidden ingredients.
trustScore.step5: Sum all four pillars: TruScore = Body + Planet + Care + Open (0-100 total)
trustScore.flagsDescription: Understanding what factors negatively and positively impact a product's Trust Score:
trustScore.flagsDescriptionForProduct: Product-specific factors that affect this product's Trust Score:
trustScore.redFlagsDesc: These factors decrease a product's Trust Score and indicate potential concerns:
trustScore.greenFlagsDesc: These factors increase a product's Trust Score and indicate positive attributes:
trustScore.flagGeopoliticsDesc: Products with missing or unclear origin information may have reduced transparency scores. Origin data helps assess supply chain reliability.
trustScore.flagNegativeNewsDesc: Products with active food recalls from the FDA or other regulatory agencies are flagged for safety concerns. Recall information is checked for food products.
trustScore.flagBoycottDesc: Products with incomplete data (missing ingredients, nutrition info, or certifications) receive lower transparency scores.
trustScore.flagSustainabilityIssuesDesc: High carbon footprint, deforestation, excessive water usage, plastic packaging, or poor environmental practices negatively impact sustainability scores.
trustScore.flagEthicsIssuesDesc: Poor labor conditions, lack of fair trade practices, animal welfare concerns, or supply chain transparency issues reduce ethics scores.
trustScore.flagNutritionIssuesDesc: High levels of additives, artificial ingredients, excessive sugar/salt, or low nutritional value negatively affect nutrition scores.
trustScore.flagProcessingIssuesDesc: Ultra-processed foods (NOVA 4), excessive processing, artificial preservation, or manufacturing concerns reduce processing scores.
trustScore.flagSustainabilityPositiveDesc: Low carbon footprint, renewable energy use, sustainable packaging, organic farming, or positive environmental impact increase sustainability scores.
trustScore.flagEthicsPositiveDesc: Fair trade certifications, ethical labor practices, animal welfare standards, or transparent supply chains positively impact ethics scores.
trustScore.flagNutritionPositiveDesc: Whole foods, minimal processing, natural ingredients, high nutritional density, or health benefits improve nutrition scores.
trustScore.flagProcessingPositiveDesc: Minimally processed (NOVA 1-2), fresh ingredients, traditional methods, or natural preservation techniques increase processing scores.
trustScore.flagCertificationsDesc: Organic, Fair Trade, B-Corp, Rainforest Alliance, or other ethical/environmental certifications add positive points to the Trust Score.
trustScore.flagPositiveReviewsDesc: Products with comprehensive data (complete ingredients, nutrition facts, certifications, origin information) receive higher transparency scores.
trustScore.novaClassificationDescription: NOVA is a food classification system that categorizes foods according to the extent and purpose of processing. It helps identify how processed a food is and its impact on health.
trustScore.novaNote: NOVA classification helps identify how processed a food is. Generally, less processed foods (NOVA 1-2) are better for health than ultra-processed foods (NOVA 4).
trustScore.nova1Description: Unprocessed or minimally processed foods. Natural foods that have been cleaned, dried, frozen, pasteurized, or undergone minimal changes that do not add substances.
trustScore.nova1Examples: Fresh fruits, vegetables, nuts, seeds, grains, fresh meat, fish, milk, eggs, water
trustScore.nova1Benefit1: High nutritional value and natural nutrients preserved
trustScore.nova1Benefit2: No added preservatives, additives, or artificial ingredients
trustScore.nova1Benefit3: Best choice for health and nutrition
trustScore.nova2Description: Processed culinary ingredients. Substances extracted or derived from natural foods, used in cooking to prepare and season dishes.
trustScore.nova2Examples: Vegetable oils, butter, salt, sugar, honey, vinegar, herbs, spices
trustScore.nova2Benefit1: Used in moderate amounts for cooking and flavoring
trustScore.nova3Description: Processed foods. Foods made by adding salt, sugar, oil, or other processed ingredients to natural or minimally processed foods to increase shelf life or improve taste.
trustScore.nova3Examples: Canned vegetables, fruit in syrup, cheese, bread, smoked meats, pickled foods
trustScore.nova3Concern1: May contain added salt, sugar, or preservatives
trustScore.nova3Concern2: Moderate nutritional value depending on ingredients
trustScore.nova4Description: Ultra-processed foods. Industrial formulations made entirely or mostly from substances extracted from foods, with little to no intact food remaining. Often contain many additives.
trustScore.nova4Examples: Soft drinks, packaged snacks, instant noodles, ready meals, reconstituted meat products, sweetened breakfast cereals
trustScore.nova4Concern1: High in added sugars, salt, unhealthy fats, and additives
trustScore.nova4Concern2: Low in fiber, vitamins, and natural nutrients
trustScore.nova4Concern3: Associated with health risks including obesity and chronic diseases
trustScore.nova4Concern4: Often contains artificial flavors, colors, and preservatives

ecoscore.title: Understanding Eco-Score
ecoscore.description: The Eco-Score is an environmental impact rating (A to E) that measures a product's ecological footprint based on life cycle assessment. It helps you choose products that are better for the planet.
ecoscore.whatItMeasuresText: The Eco-Score evaluates the environmental impact of a product from production to consumption, including farming, processing, packaging, transport, and disposal. It considers multiple environmental factors to provide a comprehensive assessment. Eco-Score data is provided by Open Food Facts and is based on the Agribalyse LCA database from ADEME (French Environmental Agency).
ecoscore.formula: Eco-Score = Base Score (CO₂: 40%, Water: 20%, Deforestation: 20%, Biodiversity: 20%) + Bonus/Malus adjustments
ecoscore.step1: Base score calculated from life cycle assessment (LCA) data
ecoscore.step2: Each environmental factor is weighted and combined
ecoscore.step3: Bonus points added for organic, local, or eco-friendly certifications
ecoscore.step4: Malus points deducted for packaging issues or problematic ingredients
ecoscore.gradeADesc: Excellent environmental performance. Minimal impact on ecosystems, climate, and resources. Best choice for the planet.
ecoscore.gradeBDesc: Good environmental performance with low to moderate impact. Sustainable production methods and efficient resource use.
ecoscore.gradeCDesc: Average environmental impact. Some areas for improvement but generally acceptable ecological footprint.
ecoscore.gradeDDesc: High environmental impact. Significant concerns regarding resource use, emissions, or ecosystem damage.
ecoscore.gradeEDesc: Very high environmental impact. Major concerns across multiple environmental factors. Consider alternatives.
ecoscore.co2Desc: Measures greenhouse gas emissions throughout the product's life cycle, from production to disposal. Lower CO₂ values indicate better climate impact.
ecoscore.waterDesc: Evaluates water consumption and water pollution during production. Considers both direct water use and indirect impacts on water resources.
ecoscore.deforestationDesc: Assesses the risk of contributing to deforestation, especially for products containing palm oil, soy, or cocoa. High risk indicates potential impact on forests and biodiversity.
ecoscore.biodiversityDesc: Measures the impact on species diversity and ecosystem health. Considers agricultural practices, land use, and potential harm to wildlife and natural habitats.
ecoscore.note: The Eco-Score is provided by Open Food Facts and is based on the Agribalyse LCA database from ADEME (French Environmental Agency). Eco-Score is available for food products in the Open Food Facts database. Scores may vary based on data availability and regional production methods. For cosmetics and personal care products, sustainability data (palm oil, packaging) is shown instead.
ecoscore.flagsDescription: Understanding what factors negatively and positively impact a product's Eco-Score:
ecoscore.redFlagsDesc: These factors decrease a product's Eco-Score and indicate environmental concerns:
ecoscore.greenFlagsDesc: These factors increase a product's Eco-Score and indicate positive environmental attributes:
ecoscore.flagGeopoliticsDesc: Products with long transport distances or unclear origin information may have higher environmental impact. Transport penalties are included in Eco-Score calculations.
ecoscore.flagNegativeNewsDesc: Products with active food recalls from the FDA are flagged for safety concerns. Recall information is checked for food products and displayed prominently.
ecoscore.flagBoycottDesc: Products with incomplete environmental data (missing LCA data, packaging info, or ingredient analysis) may have less accurate Eco-Scores.
ecoscore.flagSustainabilityIssuesDesc: High carbon footprint, deforestation, excessive water usage, plastic packaging, or poor environmental practices negatively impact Eco-Score.
ecoscore.flagEthicsIssuesDesc: Poor labor conditions, lack of fair trade practices, animal welfare concerns, or supply chain transparency issues reduce environmental scores.
ecoscore.flagNutritionIssuesDesc: High levels of additives, artificial ingredients, excessive sugar/salt, or low nutritional value negatively affect Eco-Score.
ecoscore.flagProcessingIssuesDesc: Ultra-processed foods (NOVA 4), excessive processing, artificial preservation, or manufacturing concerns reduce Eco-Score.
ecoscore.flagSustainabilityPositiveDesc: Low carbon footprint, renewable energy use, sustainable packaging, organic farming, or positive environmental impact increase Eco-Score.
ecoscore.flagEthicsPositiveDesc: Fair trade certifications, ethical labor practices, animal welfare standards, or transparent supply chains positively impact Eco-Score.
ecoscore.flagNutritionPositiveDesc: Whole foods, minimal processing, natural ingredients, high nutritional density, or health benefits improve Eco-Score.
ecoscore.flagProcessingPositiveDesc: Minimally processed (NOVA 1-2), fresh ingredients, traditional methods, or natural preservation techniques increase Eco-Score.
ecoscore.flagCertificationsDesc: Organic, Fair Trade, B-Corp, Rainforest Alliance, or other ethical/environmental certifications add positive points to the Eco-Score.
ecoscore.flagPositiveReviewsDesc: Products with complete environmental data (full LCA data, packaging recyclability, palm oil analysis, carbon footprint) provide more accurate Eco-Scores.
